title: How the fuck can anyone on the balance team think this is healthy?
body:
My team doesn't even have time to react to the 8-9-5 Nocturne instantly killing me.
There is no way for me to outplay or prevent this. The player himself was playing very poorly all game, but could entirely shut me down just by pressing R.

I really don't understand how anyone can look at this and think 'Yep, totally fine.'

https://media.giphy.com/media/28GF6sRqdsqS1qamV4/giphy.gif

**EDIT:** To be clear, this is about damage in general. This isn't specific to Nocturne, many champions can do this. My complaint is that these players can basically just kamikaze into me all game, and do it faster with each successive kill, even if they themselves are dying in the process.

To those saying "But he had Duskblade and Stormrazor, while you had no defensive items":

An explanation isn't a justification.

If I had the majority of my team's gold and were carrying, this would have completely ended the game, regardless of how well I was playing or how badly Nocturne was playing.

Nah man we got your point, you are still missing OP's point. Its not about the items, the champions, the gold, etc. it is about the action itself. Player A was instantly killed by Player B and there was no counterplay, nothing was done wrong by Player A and nothing was done right by Player B other than hitting a single button. Nothing could be done about what happened, there was no outplay, no relying on teammates.... nothing. 

The point is, why is something like this acceptable? Why should one player be able to do this to another player without actually earning it through strategic gameplay or outplay. Its about how busted the current state of the game is where this shit happens non-stop. You are either the one doing it or it is being done to you. Its not fun and its not fair for a player on a losing team who hasn't been playing very well  to instantly erase a better player simply with the push of a button with absolutely no counterplay.

I'm not saying it is acceptable (of course it isn't; this isn't an FPS where headshots instantly kill; it is supposed to be a action-strategy game), but in response to the OP condemning Nocturne's R Auto combo, I stated what was the root problem causing that much damage was the itemization, not Nocturne himself. Just think, when was the last time you saw a Shaco or Nocturne delete someone that quickly without Stormrazor?

Anyhow, I addressed this so that the proper measures could be taken to fix whatever allows that item combo to one-shot almost anyone (whether a bug or just some poorly designed synergy) instead of unnecessary nerfs to assassins who, until fairly recently, suffered because of their lack of macro compared to mages. Especially if it is a bug, then nerfing individual champions won't solve anything.

And I stated that simply because, based on the OP's own GIF, Noct's R did only 10% damage and the auto after that did the rest.

Its a major problem with a lot of bruisers and assassins right now. 

One issue is that RIOT has been adding a ton of "counterplay" to adc's, which means that champions with one gap closer can dive an enemy adc and then need to kill the adc before the adc can use his "counterplay".  If not, the adc gets away, you die, and your team loses the teamfight.  

This is what schaco is like right now.  In S5/S6 you could go with a tankier shaco build; you could win the teamfight without one-shoting someone.  Now you need to one-shot.  

It's something that riot simply did not understand.  When you give adc's more protection, either from mobility skills, cc, untargetability, or from supports, then the only way you can have viable ADC targeting champs is if these targeting champs have absurd damage. So RIOT buffs damage and everything dies super fast.

GA isn't counterplay.  The cooldown on it is far longer than Nocturne's combo.  Realistically all it does is let you revive once every 5 minutes when you get deleted.  By the time you generally build it, the game has progressed far enough that this usually means that it's ready 1/3 (or at best) 1/2 the time you need it.  Even then, it's not really counterplay either.  For a one-shot combo like the OP demonstrates, you're knocked out of combat and your team is left fighting a 4v5 for 4 seconds.  By then it might be decided and you as likely as not are just going to revive to die again. 

As for glass cannon champions, a lot of the time they don't really have any other options.  Their kits bring no utility and they rely on scaling their damage.  GA and Zhonya's are the only defensive items most ADC or mages can really afford to build.  

Even more ridiculous, however, is how even tanks aren't really building defensive effectively anymore.  With the absurd amount of damage flying around these days, even a full-build tank is getting melted within seconds.
